content.question: The ionic compounds <math alttext="N a C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="M g S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MgS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are represented by the diagrams above. choices.label: Diagram 1 represents <math alttext="N a C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>; it has a lower melting point than <math alttext="M g S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MgS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has because the coulombic attractions between the singly charged <math alttext="N a with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions and the <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions in <math alttext="N a C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are stronger than those between the ions in <math alttext="M g S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MgS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
